page.title: 06Mr Whittles' Farm
page.content: Mr Whittles is a farmer.He has passed his farm down to his son named Benjamin Whittles.Mr Whittles has rented the farm since 1948.He has rented it for 37 years.In 1948 he had 250 acres now he has 400 acres. In 1948 he had 200 acres of arable and 50 acres of pasture.Now he has 100 acres of sugar beet 50 acres of potatoes and 250 acres of cereals which includes wheat,barley and corn.He has a potato harvester to harvest the potatoes.It cost Â£20.000. He hires a beet harvester to harvest the beet.It lifts six rows at a time,it cost Â£50.000. He has various merchants that he buys his seeds from.He buys potatoes which are grown in scotland or by the coast to make them free of disease.Alscott beet factory supply him with pelleted beet seed.
